items.longDescription:
Louvre x Camille Henrot

Camille Henrot is one of the most influential voices in contemporary art today, working in film, painting, drawing, bronze, sculpture, and installation. Henrot draws upon references from literature, psychoanalysis, social media, self help and the banality of everyday life. This collection features a personal reinterpretation of Camille's favorite artworks in the Louvre Museum through digital and analog collage and graphic interventions.

Camille Henrot
Born in 1978 in Paris (France), CAMILLE HENROT lives and works in New York City. Camille Henrot is one of the most influential voices in contemporary art today and has developed a critically acclaimed practice in film, painting, drawing, bronze, sculpture, and installation. Henrot draws upon references from literature, psychoanalysis, social media, self help and the banality of everyday life to question what it means to be both a private individual and a global citizen in an increasingly connected and over-stimulated world.

Â©Camille Henrot

MAGIC FOR ALL with Yu Nagaba

A collection specially drawn by artist Yu Nagaba featuring Disney, Pixar, Marvel and STAR WARS works, with scenes selected based on the themes of love and bonds. The collection is strongly influenced by Yu Nagaba's own experiences, such as the STAR WARS movies he watched as a child and the Pixar films he watched with his children after becoming a father.

Yu Nagaba
Artist, born 1976 in Tokyo. Known for his artworks that are drawn only with simple and few lines. In addition to exhibiting his works in Japan as well as internationally, he has also participated in numerous art fairs as an artist, while also collaborating with brands in advertising and apparel.

He was awarded an AAC Award, listed in Forbesâ€™ 100 Asian Digital Stars, and received the Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology's Art Encouragement Prize for New Artists. In 2022, he released â€œM87"" as the theme song for the film Shin Ultraman, and â€œPOP SONGâ€ as the theme song for a PlayStation commercial. His single â€œKICK BACK,â€ the opening theme for the TV anime Chainsaw Man, made Spotify's Global Top 50, and became the first Japanese-language song certified Gold by RIAAÂ®. Thank you for loving me!!
This piece from the Marineford focuses on the theme of Luffyâ€™s â€œthe loss" due to the death of his beloved older brother Ace. Luffy goes to Marineford , where the Navy has its headquarters, to save his brother Ace, who has been sentenced to public execution. There, Ace defends Luffy from an attack by the Admiral Akainu and is pierced through the stomach. Ace speaks of his gratitude to his friends who loved him and dies in Luffy's arms. This is a picture of Luffy's frustration at the loss of his beloved brother.

items.longDescription:
Louvre x Camille Henrot

Camille Henrot is one of the most influential voices in contemporary art today, working in film, painting, drawing, bronze, sculpture, and installation. Henrot draws upon references from literature, psychoanalysis, social media, self help and the banality of everyday life. This collection features a personal reinterpretation of Camille's favorite artworks in the Louvre Museum through digital and analog collage and graphic interventions.

Camille Henrot
Born in 1978 in Paris (France), CAMILLE HENROT lives and works in New York City. Camille Henrot is one of the most influential voices in contemporary art today and has developed a critically acclaimed practice in film, painting, drawing, bronze, sculpture, and installation. Henrot draws upon references from literature, psychoanalysis, social media, self help and the banality of everyday life to question what it means to be both a private individual and a global citizen in an increasingly connected and over-stimulated world.

Â©Camille Henrot

A collection specially drawn by artist Yu Nagaba featuring Disney, Pixar, Marvel and STAR WARS works, with scenes selected based on the themes of love and bonds. The collection is strongly influenced by Yu Nagaba's own experiences, such as the STAR WARS movies he watched as a child and the Pixar films he watched with his children after becoming a father.

Artist, born 1976 in Tokyo. Known for his artworks that are drawn only with simple and few lines. In addition to exhibiting his works in Japan as well as internationally, he has also participated in numerous art fairs as an artist, while also collaborating with brands in advertising and apparel.

MAGIC FOR ALL with Yu Nagaba

A collection specially drawn by artist Yu Nagaba featuring Disney, Pixar, Marvel and STAR WARS works, with scenes selected based on the themes of love and bonds. The collection is strongly influenced by Yu Nagaba's own experiences, such as the STAR WARS movies he watched as a child and the Pixar films he watched with his children after becoming a father.

Yu Nagaba
Artist, born 1976 in Tokyo. Known for his artworks that are drawn only with simple and few lines. In addition to exhibiting his works in Japan as well as internationally, he has also participated in numerous art fairs as an artist, while also collaborating with brands in advertising and apparel.
